result.execSummary:
The defendant Quavon K Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
All court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.
AS TO RESTITUTION/COURT COSTS, SURCHARGES:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence/count.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
All applicable fees of supervision to be paid by end of supervision.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Quavon K Davis in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Quavon K Davis in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS with 420 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $3,699.00 payable to Susan R; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit


Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Quavon K Davis in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Quavon K Davis in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with plea hearing instead.
Pursuant to negotiations, Counts 2-5 are DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Jury trial scheduled for 03/23/2015 is vacated.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Quavon K Davis not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however defense attorney was not able to get to court until 12:15 and case was adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood NOT in court, defendant Quavon K Davis not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense attorney is not present without explanation.  Case adjourned and remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quavon K Davis in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood via telephone.  Defendant Quavon K Davis in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial, for reasons stated on the record, Court ordered Jury Trial adjourned.  Jury Trial scheduled for 09/29/2014 is ordered vacated.  Defense requests new final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Copy of entire court file forwarded to Andrea Dunn, Client Services Specialist/Intern (State Public Defender Office - 819 N 6th St)

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court, defendant Quavon K Davis not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated off the record to the Court, Final Pretrial, Jury Trial and Status Conference scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.
Final Pretrial AS TO COUNTS 3-4 ONLY  scheduled for 09-12-2014 at 08:30am and Jury Trial  AS TO COUNTS 3-4 ONLY scheduled for 09-29-2014 at 09:00 am.
Status Conference AS TO COUNTS 1,-2, 5 ONLY, scheduled for 09-12-2014 at 08:30am.

Defendant Quavon K Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's counsel had requested an adjourned date via electronic transmission due to his unavailability for this date.  Electronic transmission sent to both counsel with proposed date of 06-20-2014 at 08:30am.  Response was received from Defense Counsel as to availability of that date.  Status Conference remained on today's Court's Calendar to allow response from Assistant District Attorney.  Status Conference adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Status Conference scheduled for 06-20-2014 at 08:30am.
Defense Counsel appears after case was adjourned and receives adjourned Status Conference date.

Defendant Quavon K Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
After waiting an appropriate timeframe for arrival of Defense Counsel, Court scheduled next hearing in a timely manner with Counsel for the State.  Status conference scheduled for 05-29-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court, defendant Quavon K Davis not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Status conference scheduled for 05-13-2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-15-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quavon K Davis in court with Attorney Caitlin Firer, appearing for Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Quavon K Davis in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Detective Robert St. Onge and Officer Laura Litwin.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Defendant has a lower number case pending in Branch 22.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 22.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Quavon K Davis in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Quavon K Davis in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor counts 4 and 5.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
